intro: Ardisia liesneri, commonly known as the Brazilian flame tree, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its showy, bright red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has glossy, dark green leaves and produces small, dark berries that are edible for some bird species. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and ability to thrive in tropical and subtropical climates. Ardisia liesneri is also valued for its ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
